TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NetMsmqSecurity extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The class encapsulates the MSMQ security features available when using the binding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Objects of this type are created by creating an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding> binding. You can then use this object to reference all of the various security settings related to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding> binding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityOverMsmq> encapsulates the SOAP message security settings.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UENetMsmqSecurity#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/uenetmsmqsecurity/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[UENetMsmqSecurity#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/uenetmsmqsecurity/vb/program.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that is associated with the binding.
Docs.value: The that is associated with the binding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property determines the type of security used by the associated NetMsmqBinding. The following list describes the acceptable values:
- **None** - no security is used.
- **Transport** - transport security is used.
- **Message** - message-based security is used.
- **Both** - both message-based security and transport security is used.
